meanings.definition: To move swiftly and in an uncontrolled way
meanings.sent1: The car was careering down the hill, out of control.
meanings.sent2: The skateboarder was careering down the ramp at the skate park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was careering through the trees, chasing after its acorn.
meanings.sent4: The river careering over the waterfall was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The careering train whistle echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The project was careering towards completion ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The snowball was careering down the hill, growing bigger and faster.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was careering around the house, knocking things over in its excitement.
meanings.sent4: The news of the discovery was careering through the scientific community.
meanings.sent5: The careering rocket blasted off into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: To engage in a profession or occupation, especially in a reckless or irresponsible manner
meanings.sent1: He was careering into the world of finance without any prior experience.
meanings.sent2: She was careering into acting without attending any auditions.
meanings.sent3: The chef was careering through the kitchen, creating chaos with his experimental dishes.
meanings.sent4: The artist was careering through the art world, gaining fame for controversial pieces.
meanings.sent5: The student was careering into journalism, eager to uncover the truth.
